post.description: To authenticate, provide your email and password created in the POST /clinicians endpoint. After authenticating, you'll receive an access token, insert this token in the 'Authorize' button above to access the protected routes.

401.description: Wrong credentials

post.description: To authenticate, provide your email and password created in the POST /patients endpoint. After authenticating, you'll receive an access token, insert this token in the 'Authorize' button above to access the protected routes.

401.description: Wrong credentials

post.description: Send a token to the user's email address to reset

patch.description: Reset password after receiving a token in the user's email address. The token is valid for 1 hour. If the token is expired, the user must request a new one.

post.description: Insert an neurofunctional record. All fields are required. This route is protected, only clinicians can access it.

anamnesis.example: Pacient anamnesis. An history of the disease and other things.

physicalExamination.example: The physical state of the patient. Important information about the situation will be included here.

treatmentGoals.example: Such as exercises, objectives and possibilities for improvement

get.description: Get a record by neurofunctional record id. This route is protected, only the patient from the record, clinician who created it and users authorized by the patient can access it.

put.description: Edit an neurofunctional record. All fields are required. This route is protected, only the clinician who created the record can access it.

anamnesis.example: Pacient anamnesis. An edited history of the disease and other things.

physicalExamination.example: The edited physical state of the patient. Important edited information about the situation will be included here.

diagnosis.example: Here will be the edited diagnosis

treatmentGoals.example: Such as exercises, objectives and possibilities for improvement

physiotherapeuticConduct.example: Here will be the edited conduct
